clinical_study.brief_title: Lung Function and Airway Inflammation in Portland Cement Workers
clinical_study.official_title: Airway Inflammation in Cement Dust Exposed Workers

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to examine inflammation in the airways and in peripheral blood, in workers in a cement plant i Norway.

detailed_description.textblock:
OBJECTIVE: Former studies have presented conflicting data on the association between exposure to Portland cement dust and respiratory effects. Our goal is to examine inflammation in the airways and in peripheral blood in subjects exposed to cement-dust.
METHODS: All non smoking, dust exposed, workers from one department in the largest cement plant in Norway, are invited to participate. The workers will perform spirometry and induced sputum (IS) after a period of regular work with cement dust exposure, and again after a minimum of 5 days without exposure. Information on respiratory symptoms, allergy and former respiratory disease will be given on a self-reported questionnaire. IS was performed and processed as described by Pin et al. Differential cell counts will be carried out. Inflammatory markers in induced sputum and in peripheral blood will be measured. We want to use a crossover design were the cases are used as their own controls, but we will also include external controls.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of neutrophile cells in induced sputum
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after a period of exposure
primary_outcome.description: A significantly higher percentage of neutrophils was observed in induced sputum samples from cement production workers collected during an exposed period compared with a nonexposed period and compared with external controls.

primary_outcome.measure: Concentration of Interleukin 1beta in induced sputum
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after a period of exposure to cement production dust
primary_outcome.description: The concentration of Interleukin 1beta was higher in the sputum of workers during an exposed period than that of the office workers or the external controls.

biospec_descr.textblock: Induced sputum samples and blood samples

study_pop.textblock: Workers from Norways largest cement plant

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Cement dust exposure
- Non-smoker or ex-smoker >3 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Infectious disease during the last 3 weeks
- Chronic airway disease
